item.title: Lana Clayton Used Eye Drops to Poison Her Husband? | The Visine Case
item.description: When Steven Clayton died suddenly, the cause wasn’t clear. Investigators later discovered he had been poisoned with eye drops, leading to shocking revelations about his wife, Lana.

media:content.media:title: Lana Clayton Used Eye Drops to Poison Her Husband? | The Visine Case
media:content.media:description: When Steven Clayton died suddenly, the cause wasn’t clear. Investigators later discovered he had been poisoned with eye drops, leading to shocking revelations about his wife, Lana.

item.title: Unsolved: The Dardeen Family Massacre
item.description: In 1987, the Dardeen family was found murdered under disturbing circumstances. Despite multiple leads and theories, the case remains unsolved.

item.title: When Halloween Decorations Go Too Far
item.description: When Halloween Decorations Go Too Far

item.title: Did an Activity Tracker Help Solve Her Murder? | The Connie Dabate Case
item.description: When Connie Dabate was killed, her husband claimed a home intruder was responsible. But investigators uncovered digital evidence that told a different story.

item.title: Murder, Fraud, Privilege, and Corruption | The Murdaugh Family Mystery
item.description: The Murdaugh family once held major influence in South Carolina. Then scandals, financial crimes, and multiple deaths came to light.

item.title: Did Her Husband Do This To His Family On Purpose?!
item.description: Did Her Husband Do This To His Family On Purpose?!

item.title: The Man Who Faked His Own Death | John Darwin
item.description: John Darwin staged his own death in a canoe accident to escape financial trouble, leaving his family and the public stunned. This video looks at how the plan unraveled and what happened after the truth came out.

item.title: He Poisoned Her Cereal With What?! The Murder of Christina Harris
item.description: Christina Harris’s sudden death first appeared to be natural. But investigators uncovered a disturbing truth involving her husband and a hidden toxic substance. This video examines the case, the evidence, and the search for justice.

item.title: The Sad Case Of Ryan Poston
item.description: On October 12, 2012, 29-year-old attorney Ryan Carter Poston was fatally shot six times in his Highland Heights, Kentucky home by his on-again, off-again girlfriend Shayna Michelle Hubers, who claimed self-defense. After a first murder conviction in 2015, her verdict was overturned and she was retried in 2018, where she was again found guilty and later sentenced to life with parole eligibility after 17–20 years.

item.title: Christopher Langan: The Mind That Terrifies Scientists
item.description: Christopher Langan claims one of the highest IQ scores ever recorded and created his own theory of reality. Some see him as a genius, others as controversial. This video explores his life, beliefs, and why his ideas spark debate.

item.title: A Missing Girl, Family Secrets, and a Shocking Return | The Mary Day Case
item.description: Mary Day vanished in 1983, raising questions within her family for years. Investigators suspected foul play, until a woman claiming to be Mary resurfaced nearly two decades later, leaving the case surrounded by uncertainty.

item.title: Unsolved: The Mysterious Deaths of Don Henry and Kevin Ives
item.description: In 1987, best friends Don Henry and Kevin Ives were found dead on train tracks in Arkansas, sparking decades of speculation and controversy. What was first ruled an accident soon raised serious questions when new evidence suggested something much darker may have happened. From local corruption theories to missing evidence, this case has remained one of the most debated mysteries in American true crime history. In this video, we revisit the events leading up to that night, the investigations that followed, and why the truth about what really happened to Don and Kevin still remains unclear today.

item.title: Tourists Found Dead Near Their Hotel on Thailand’s Infamous Koh Tao Island | The Case of Hannah Witheridge and David Miller
item.description: Hannah Witheridge and David Miller traveled to Thailand hoping to enjoy the beauty and excitement of Koh Tao, a destination loved by travelers from around the world. But their trip took a tragic turn when the two were found dead near their hotel, sparking one of the most controversial investigations in recent Thai history. Allegations of police misconduct, wrongful convictions, and the influence of local power figures left many questioning what really happened. In this video, we revisit the case, examine the evidence, and explore why the island has earned such an unsettling reputation among travelers.

item.title: Did a Father Intentionally Leave His Son in the Car? | The Cooper Harris Case
item.description: The heartbreaking case of Cooper Harris left the public divided and searching for answers. In 2014, a young boy lost his life after being left in a hot car, and investigators soon turned their attention to his father, Ross Harris. What at first seemed like a terrible accident quickly became one of the most debated court cases in recent years. In this video, we explore the events of that day, the evidence presented in court, and the questions that still surround this deeply emotional case.

item.title: Frank Abagnale Jr. The Greatest Conman
item.description: Before turning 21, Frank Abagnale Jr. had successfully posed as a pilot, doctor, and lawyer, while cashing millions in fraudulent checks around the world. His unbelievable story of deception and eventual redemption inspired the hit film Catch Me If You Can. In this video, we take a closer look at how Abagnale pulled off his elaborate cons, how the FBI finally caught up with him, and the surprising way he turned his life around to help stop others from doing the same.

item.title: Ivy League Genius Kevin Jiang Lost His Life to Fiancée's Stalker
item.description: Yale graduate student and U.S. Army veteran Kevin Jiang was fatally shot outside his fiancée’s apartment in New Haven on February 6, 2021. In 2024, a former MIT researcher pleaded guilty to his murder and was sentenced to 35 years behind bars.

item.title: He Hijacked a Plane Then Jumped with $200K and Vanished | The Unsolved D.B. Cooper Case
item.description: In one of the most mysterious crimes in U.S. history, an unidentified man known as D.B. Cooper hijacked a plane, demanded $200,000 in cash, and then parachuted into the night—never to be seen again. Decades later, the case still fascinates investigators and true crime followers around the world. In this video, we break down what happened that day, the major suspects over the years, and the theories that might finally explain what became of D.B. Cooper.

item.title: She Went to a Doctor’s Appointment and Never Came Back | The Murder of Maria Cruz
item.description: Maria Cruz was a driven young woman with a bright future ahead of her. When she went to a doctor’s appointment in New York City and never returned, her loved ones were left terrified and desperate for answers. What followed uncovered a shocking betrayal by someone she trusted. In this video, we look at Maria’s life, the investigation that revealed the truth, and the lasting impact of her story on those who knew and loved her.

item.title: Missing Baby Found After 51 Years | The Incredible Story of Melissa Highsmith
item.description: Melissa Highsmith’s story is nothing short of miraculous. Taken as a baby in the early 1970s, she was missing for more than five decades before a DNA match finally reunited her with her family. This emotional case shows the power of hope, persistence, and modern technology in bringing long-awaited answers. In this video, we explore how Melissa was found, how her family never gave up searching, and what her reunion means after 51 long years apart.

item.title: This Case Haunted His Brother For 35 Years | Jacob Jeremiah Landin
item.description: In April 1987, nine-month-old Jacob Jeremiah Landin died of a subdural hematoma in New Mexico. Though a confession was allegedly made by the mother’s boyfriend, no charges were ever filed. His brother Eric Carter-Landin has spent over 35 years seeking accountability and justice.
